page.title: 01AREA DESCRIPTION
page.content: Most of the area is{farming}with crops other than grass, but a small area is uncultivated. Most of the people who live in the area are farmers. There are no{recreation centres or clubs of any description apart from Forfar Golf Club. The only places of religious worship are Rescobie{church}and Restenneth Priory where a service is held once a year, but unfortunately most of the Priory is in ruins. The Hunter Library at Restenneth has mainly books but there are also some swords and armour. Trout are raised on some of the farms and then put into Rescobie loch for fishermen to catch. Mostly the area is very picturesque. The{forest}is a favourite with the locals with long walks. There are also deer and squirrels in the forest.
